channel.title: Can someone please explain why this doesn't work -- probability sel 4
channel.description: I tried SSS's sel/4chanceSeq object and it wouldn't work when selecting consecutive squares. I made my own subpatch with factory objects and it has the same problem. Any ideas why this is the case? Thanks probability sel 4.axs (14.7 KB)

item.title: Can someone please explain why this doesn't work -- probability sel 4
item.dc:creator: @Nosnibor
item.description:
@Nosnibor wrote:

Oof, that looks complicated. But yes, logic/change on the input is the important part to get a new trigger pulse each time the input changes, because the /phi/prob/%bang_in need those trigger pulses to do anything.
I have come up with my own version of the patch (not yet tested). It uses logic/latch before the outputs to deliver steady signals (as the old patch did) instead of short pulses.
probability sel 4a.axs (8.7 KB)

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone please explain why this doesn't work -- probability sel 4

item.title: Can someone please explain why this doesn't work -- probability sel 4
item.dc:creator: @omgzilla
item.description:
@omgzilla wrote:

you need a logic/change object on the counter inlet to trigger consecutive bangs.

i've updated for anyone that stumbles on this laterprobability sel 4.axs (18.3 KB)

Read full topic
